ide.message:
WRITE-MSG: WRITE-MSG is a variable used to hold different parts of a message that is written to a queue or sent as a text in various CICS programs. It is composed of different subfields depending on the context in which it is used.

**** GENAPP CNTL - A control message for the GENAPP application. (see base/src/lgicvs01.cbl:55: 55          03 WRITE-MSG-E            PIC X(20) Value '**** GENAPP CNTL'.)
LOW CUSTOMER= - A message indicating the start of a low customer range. (see base/src/lgicvs01.cbl:56: 56          03 WRITE-MSG-L              PIC X(13) Value 'LOW CUSTOMER='.)
HIGH CUSTOMER= - A message indicating the start of a high customer range. (see base/src/lgicvs01.cbl:59: 59          03 WRITE-MSG-H              PIC X(14) Value 'HIGH CUSTOMER='.)
Policy Key= - A message indicating the key of a policy. (see base/src/lgipvs01.cbl:39: 39          03 WRITE-MSG-Text           PIC X(11) Value 'Policy Key='.)
  Statistics. - A message indicating statistical information. (see base/src/lgwebst5.cbl:68: 68        01  WRITE-MSG-H                PIC X(24) Value '  Statistics.'.)
Policy Bad= - A message indicating a bad policy. (see base/src/lgipvs01.cbl:123: 123              Move 'Policy Bad='   To Write-Msg-Text)
  
Used in the following paths:

base/src/lgstsq.cbl
base/src/lgicvs01.cbl
base/src/lgipvs01.cbl
base/src/lgsetup.cbl
base/src/lgwebst5.cbl

STSQ: STSQ is a variable used to represent a Temporary Storage Queue (TSQ) name in the CICS environment. It is used in various operations such as writing to, reading from, and deleting the TSQ. The variable ensures that the correct TSQ is referenced during these operations.

STEWSTEW - A specific TSQ name used in the application. (see base/src/lgastat1.cbl:53: 53        77  STSQ-name                   PIC X(8)  Value 'STEWSTEW'.)
GENAERRS - A specific TSQ name used in the application. (see base/src/lgstsq.cbl:82: 82            MOVE 'GENAERRS' TO STSQ-NAME.)
GENASTRT - A specific TSQ name used in the application. (see base/src/lgsetup.cbl:56: 56        01  STSQ-STRT                 PIC X(8)  Value 'GENASTRT'.)
GENASTAT - A specific TSQ name used in the application. (see base/src/lgsetup.cbl:57: 57        01  STSQ-STAT                 PIC X(8)  Value 'GENASTAT'.)
GENAERRS - A specific TSQ name used in the application. (see base/src/lgsetup.cbl:58: 58        01  STSQ-ERRS                 PIC X(8)  Value 'GENAERRS'.)
GENACNTL - A specific TSQ name used in the application. (see base/src/lgicvs01.cbl:63: 63          03  STSQ-NAME                 PIC X(8) Value 'GENACNTL'.)
  
Used in the following paths:

base/src/lgstsq.cbl
base/src/lgtestc1.cbl
base/src/lgastat1.cbl
base/src/lgsetup.cbl
base/src/lgicvs01.cbl

WS-RECV: WS-RECV is a variable used to receive data in various CICS programs. It consists of two parts: WS-RECV-TRANID, which is a 5-character transaction ID, and WS-RECV-DATA, which is a 74-character data field.

SPACES - The variable is initialized to spaces. (see base/src/lgipvs01.cbl:77: MOVE SPACES TO WS-RECV.)
  
Used in the following paths:

base/src/lgstsq.cbl
base/src/lgsetup.cbl
base/src/lgipvs01.cbl
base/src/lgicvs01.cbl

WS-INVOKEPROG: WS-INVOKEPROG is an 8-character alphanumeric variable used to store the name of the invoking program in a CICS transaction. It helps in determining the source and type of transaction being processed.


  
Used in the following paths:

base/src/lgstsq.cbl
base/src/lgipvs01.cbl

WS-FLAG: WS-FLAG is a working storage variable used to control the flow of the program based on its value.

C - The program is in a state where it needs to handle a specific condition, possibly related to a customer. (see base/src/lgicvs01.cbl:110:                MOVE 'C' To WS-FLAG)
R - The program is in a state where it needs to send a response text to the terminal. (see base/src/lgicvs01.cbl:118:                MOVE 'R' To WS-FLAG)
  
Used in the following paths:

base/src/lgstsq.cbl
base/src/lgtestc1.cbl
base/src/lgicvs01.cbl

COMMA-DATA: COMMA-DATA is a variable used in the context of CICS (Customer Information Control System) applications. It is part of the DFHCOMMAREA, which is a communication area used to pass data between programs in a CICS environment. The variable is used to store and transfer data, typically in the form of a string, between different parts of the application.


  
Used in the following paths:

base/src/lgstsq.cbl
base/src/lgicvs01.cbl
base/src/soavcio.cpy

WRITE-MSG-MSG: WRITE-MSG-MSG is a variable used to store message content in the general insurance application (GenApp) for IBM CICS Transaction Server for z/OS (CICS TS). It is part of the WRITE-MSG structure, which includes other fields like WRITE-MSG-SYSID and FILLER-X. The variable is used in various parts of the application to handle and process messages, including inserting, querying, and deleting policy information.

SPACES - Spaces (blank value). (see base/src/lgstsq.cbl:57: MOVE SPACES TO WRITE-MSG.)
  
Used in the following paths:

base/src/lgstsq.cbl

WS-RECV-LEN: WS-RECV-LEN is a variable used to store the length of the data received in a CICS RECEIVE command. It is defined as a signed 4-digit computational field with an initial value of 80.

11 - The length of the data received is 11 bytes. (see base/src/lgipvs01.cbl:95: MOVE 11 TO WS-RECV-LEN)
  
Used in the following paths:

base/src/lgstsq.cbl
base/src/lgsetup.cbl
base/src/lgipvs01.cbl

WS-RECV-DATA: WS-RECV-DATA is a variable defined in the COBOL program to hold a portion of the data received from a transaction. It is part of the WS-RECV structure, which also includes WS-RECV-TRANID. The variable is used to store data that is later moved to other variables or used in various operations within the program.


  
Used in the following paths:

base/src/lgstsq.cbl
base/src/lgsetup.cbl
base/src/lgicvs01.cbl

STSQ-NAME: STSQ-NAME is an 8-character alphanumeric field used to represent the name of a Temporary Storage Queue (TSQ) in CICS. It is used in various CICS commands to identify the TSQ for operations such as writing, reading, deleting, and enqueueing/dequeueing resources.

GENAERRS - Represents a specific TSQ name used for error messages in the GenApp application. (see base/src/lgstsq.cbl:82: 82            MOVE 'GENAERRS' TO STSQ-NAME.)
GENACNTL - Represents a specific TSQ name used for control messages in the GenApp application. (see base/src/lgicvs01.cbl:63: 63          03  STSQ-NAME                 PIC X(8) Value 'GENACNTL'.)
SMITH - Represents a specific TSQ name, possibly used for a customer or user-related queue in the GenApp application. (see base/wsim/sname.txt:5: SNAME  MSGUTBL  (SMITH     ),)
  
Used in the following paths:

base/src/lgstsq.cbl
base/src/lgtestc1.cbl
base/src/lgsetup.cbl
base/src/lgicvs01.cbl

STSQ-EXT: STSQ-EXT is a variable that holds a 4-character extension for the temporary storage queue name in the CICS application. It is used to store a part of the message content when the message starts with 'Q='.


  
Used in the following paths:

base/src/lgstsq.cbl

LGUPOL01------WS - An identifier for the program or module using WS-HEADER. (see base/src/lgupol01.cbl:25: 03 WS-EYECATCHER PIC X(16) VALUE 'LGUPOL01------WS'.)

DB2-IN-INTEGERS: DB2-IN-INTEGERS is a host variable used to store input integer values for DB2 operations. It is initialized before performing database operations to ensure that the fields are set to their default states.

EM-VARIABLE: EM-VARIABLE is used to store error messages or specific data related to policy and customer numbers in the CICS application.

' NO COMMAREA RECEIVED' - Indicates that no communication area was received. (see base/src/lgacus01.cbl:96: MOVE ' NO COMMAREA RECEIVED' TO EM-VARIABLE)
SPACES - Indicates that the variable is initialized to spaces. (see base/src/lgacus01.cbl:44: 03 EM-VARIABLE              PIC X(21) VALUE SPACES.)
Structured values with ' PNUM=', ' CNUM=', and 'SPACES' - Indicates that the variable can hold policy and customer numbers. (see base/src/lgapvs01.cbl:63-67: 03 EM-VARIABLE.
  05 FILLER                 PIC X(6)  VALUE ' PNUM='.
  05 EM-POLNUM              PIC X(10)  VALUE SPACES.
  05 FILLER                 PIC X(6)  VALUE ' CNUM='.
  05 EM-CUSNUM              PIC X(10)  VALUE SPACES.)
  
Used in the following paths:

base/src/lgdpdb01.cbl
base/src/lgacus01.cbl
base/src/lgapvs01.cbl

WS-CA-HEADER-LEN: WS-CA-HEADER-LEN is used to check the length of the commarea to ensure it is sufficient for processing. If the commarea length is less than the required length, an error return code is set and the program returns to the caller.

EM-SQLREQ: The variable EM-SQLREQ is used to store SQL query strings that are executed against a database. It is used to specify the type of SQL operation being performed, such as SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, or DELETE, along with the target table and other relevant details.

 UPDATE CUST  - UPDATE operation on the CUSTOMER table. (see base/src/lgucdb01.cbl:154: MOVE ' UPDATE CUST ' TO EM-SQLREQ)
 INSERT POLICY - INSERT operation into the POLICY table. (see base/src/lgapdb01.cbl:267: MOVE ' INSERT POLICY' TO EM-SQLREQ)
 INSERT ENDOW  - INSERT operation into the ENDOWMENT table. (see base/src/lgapdb01.cbl:333: MOVE ' INSERT ENDOW ' TO EM-SQLREQ)
 INSERT HOUSE  - INSERT operation into the HOUSE table. (see base/src/lgapdb01.cbl:408: MOVE ' INSERT HOUSE ' TO EM-SQLREQ)
 INSERT MOTOR  - INSERT operation into the MOTOR table. (see base/src/lgapdb01.cbl:448: MOVE ' INSERT MOTOR ' TO EM-SQLREQ)
 INSERT COMMER - INSERT operation into the COMMERCIAL table. (see base/src/lgapdb01.cbl:498: MOVE ' INSERT COMMER' TO EM-SQLREQ)
 INSERT SECURITY - INSERT operation into the CUSTOMER_SECURE table. (see base/src/lgacdb02.cbl:165: MOVE ' INSERT SECURITY' TO EM-SQLREQ)
 INSERT CUSTOMER - INSERT operation into the CUSTOMER table. (see base/src/lgacdb01.cbl:219: MOVE ' INSERT CUSTOMER' TO EM-SQLREQ)
 FETCH  ROW  - FETCH operation from a cursor. (see base/src/lgupdb01.cbl:229: MOVE ' FETCH  ROW   ' TO EM-SQLREQ)
 OPEN PCURSOR - OPEN operation for the POLICY_CURSOR. (see base/src/lgupdb01.cbl:254: MOVE ' OPEN   PCURSOR ' TO EM-SQLREQ)
 UPDATE POLICY - UPDATE operation on the POLICY table. (see base/src/lgupdb01.cbl:317: MOVE ' UPDATE POLICY  ' TO EM-SQLREQ)
 CLOSE PCURSOR - CLOSE operation for the POLICY_CURSOR. (see base/src/lgupdb01.cbl:364: MOVE ' CLOSE  PCURSOR' TO EM-SQLREQ)
-501 detected c - SQL error with code -501 detected. (see base/src/lgupdb01.cbl:374: MOVE '-501 detected c' TO EM-SQLREQ)
 UPDATE ENDOW - UPDATE operation on the ENDOWMENT table. (see base/src/lgupdb01.cbl:393: MOVE ' UPDATE ENDOW ' TO EM-SQLREQ)
 UPDATE HOUSE - UPDATE operation on the HOUSE table. (see base/src/lgupdb01.cbl:430: MOVE ' UPDATE HOUSE ' TO EM-SQLREQ)
 UPDATE MOTOR - UPDATE operation on the MOTOR table. (see base/src/lgupdb01.cbl:468: MOVE ' UPDATE MOTOR ' TO EM-SQLREQ)
 SELECT ENDOW - SELECT operation from the ENDOWMENT table. (see base/src/lgipdb01.cbl:329: MOVE ' SELECT ENDOW ' TO EM-SQLREQ)
 SELECT HOUSE - SELECT operation from the HOUSE table. (see base/src/lgipdb01.cbl:443: MOVE ' SELECT HOUSE ' TO EM-SQLREQ)
 SELECT MOTOR - SELECT operation from the MOTOR table. (see base/src/lgipdb01.cbl:531: MOVE ' SELECT MOTOR ' TO EM-SQLREQ)
 DELETE POLICY - DELETE operation from the POLICY table. (see base/src/lgdpdb01.cbl:188: MOVE ' DELETE POLICY  ' TO EM-SQLREQ)
 SELECT Commercial - SELECT operation from the COMMERCIAL table. (see base/src/lgipdb01.cbl:629: MOVE ' SELECT Commercial ' TO EM-SQLREQ)
  
Used in the following paths:

base/src/lgdpdb01.cbl
base/src/lgucdb01.cbl
base/src/lgapdb01.cbl
base/src/lgacdb02.cbl
base/src/lgacdb01.cbl
base/src/lgupdb01.cbl
base/src/lgipdb01.cbl
base/src/lgicdb01.cbl

EM-SQLRC: EM-SQLRC is used to store the SQL return code (SQLCODE) after executing a SQL statement. It helps in determining the outcome of the SQL operation and handling errors accordingly.

100 - No rows found in the database. (see base/src/lgipdb01.cbl:421: IF SQLCODE EQUAL 100)
0 - SQL operation was successful. (see base/src/lgipdb01.cbl:370: IF SQLCODE = 0)
non-zero (other than 100) - General error condition. (see base/src/lgipdb01.cbl:518: MOVE '90' TO CA-RETURN-CODE)
  
Used in the following paths:

base/src/lgdpdb01.cbl
base/src/lgucdb01.cbl

WS-FLAG-TSQE: WS-FLAG-TSQE is a working-storage variable used to control the writing of messages to a temporary storage queue in a CICS environment. It is used to determine whether certain operations related to the queue should be performed.

Y - Indicates that the operation related to the temporary storage queue should be performed. (see base/src/lgicvs01.cbl:125: Move 'Y'        to WS-FLAG-TSQE)

WS-FLAG-TSQH: WS-FLAG-TSQH is a flag used to control the writing of messages to a Temporary Storage Queue (TSQ) in a CICS environment. When set to 'Y', it triggers the writing of different types of messages to the queue, ensuring that messages are queued correctly based on their priority.

Y - Indicates that messages should be written to the TSQ. (see base/src/lgicvs01.cbl:126: Move 'Y'        to WS-FLAG-TSQH)
Space - Indicates that messages should not be written to the TSQ. (see base/src/lgicvs01.cbl:153: Move Space to WS-FLAG-TSQH)
  
Used in the following paths:

base/src/lgicvs01.cbl
base/src/lgtestc1.cbl

WS-FLAG-TSQL: WS-FLAG-TSQL is a flag used to control the writing of messages to a TS (Temporary Storage) Queue in a CICS environment. It is used to determine whether certain operations related to customer data should be performed.

Y - Indicates that the flag is set and certain operations related to customer data should be performed. (see base/src/lgicvs01.cbl:127: 127            Move 'Y'        to WS-FLAG-TSQL)
Space - Indicates that the flag is not set and certain operations related to customer data should not be performed. (see base/src/lgicvs01.cbl:148: 148                       Move Space to WS-FLAG-TSQL)
  
Used in the following paths:

base/src/lgicvs01.cbl
base/src/lgsetup.cbl

DFHRESP(NORMAL) - Normal response (see base/src/lgipvs01.cbl:122: If WS-RESP NOT = DFHRESP(NORMAL))
DFHRESP(NORMAL) - Normal response (see base/src/lgicvs01.cbl:137: If WS-RESP = DFHRESP(NORMAL))
DFHRESP(NORMAL) - Normal response (see base/src/lgicvs01.cbl:145: If WS-RESP = DFHRESP(NORMAL) And)
DFHRESP(NORMAL) - Normal response (see base/src/lgastat1.cbl:89: If WS-RESP = DFHRESP(NORMAL))
DFHRESP(NORMAL) - Normal response (see base/src/lgacvs01.cbl:75: If WS-RESP Not = DFHRESP(NORMAL))

DB2-OUT-INTEGERS: DB2-OUT-INTEGERS is a variable that holds a group of integer values used as host variables for output from DB2 database operations. These variables are used to store the results of queries and other interactions with the DB2 database.

CA-RETURN-CODE: CA-RETURN-CODE is used to indicate the result of various operations within the CICS application. It is set to different values based on the outcome of operations such as database updates, error handling, and transaction processing.

00 - Successful operation (see base/src/lgapdb01.cbl:293: MOVE '00' TO CA-RETURN-CODE)
70 - Customer does not exist (see base/src/lgapdb01.cbl:296: MOVE '70' TO CA-RETURN-CODE)
02 - Timestamp mismatch between policy table and commarea (see base/src/lgupdb01.cbl:346: MOVE '02' TO CA-RETURN-CODE)
99 - Request not recognized or supported (see base/src/lgdpol01.cbl:124: MOVE '99' TO CA-RETURN-CODE)
80 - Error with RESP value not equal to DFHRESP(NORMAL) (see base/src/lgapvs01.cbl:144: MOVE '80' TO CA-RETURN-CODE)
82 - Error with RESP value not equal to DFHRESP(NORMAL) and ABEND issued (see base/src/lgucvs01.cbl:92: MOVE '82' TO CA-RETURN-CODE)
89 - Non-zero SQLCODE from SQL OPEN statement (see base/src/lgipdb01.cbl:844: MOVE '89' TO CA-RETURN-CODE)
88 - Non-zero SQLCODE from SQL CLOSE statement (see base/src/lgipdb01.cbl:856: MOVE '88' TO CA-RETURN-CODE)
81 - Error with RESP value not equal to DFHRESP(NORMAL) and ABEND issued (see base/src/lgucvs01.cbl:79: MOVE '81' TO CA-RETURN-CODE)
01 - Non-zero SQLCODE from UPDATE statement with SQLCODE equal to 100 (see base/src/lgucdb01.cbl:174: MOVE '01' TO CA-RETURN-CODE)
90 - Non-zero SQLCODE from UPDATE statement (see base/src/lgacus01.cbl:176: MOVE '90' TO CA-RETURN-CODE)
98 - EIBCALEN is less than the required length (see base/src/lgacus01.cbl:113: MOVE '98' TO CA-RETURN-CODE)
00 - Successful operation (see base/src/lgacus01.cbl:102: MOVE '00' TO CA-RETURN-CODE)
90 - Error in SQL execution and ABEND issued to back out transaction (see base/src/lgapdb01.cbl:390: MOVE '90' TO CA-RETURN-CODE)
